head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #30

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #30 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Hired Transport Schooner Nancy at anchor in Michilimakinac roads, in the month of October 1813.

Fore part of this day foggy disagreeable weather, wind at NNE & moderate, shortened in cable, at ½ past 2 PM recd an order from Capt Rd Bullock to sail for Matchedash the letter is dated 24th Inst, I immediately answd it, latter part of the day wind chops round to NNW & becomes more clear, at intervals – at 8 PM set the watch[.]

At 6 AM calm & cloudy weather at ¼ past 8 AM John Askin Junr Esqr & Mr Fred: Oliva, & McGulpin a Baker came on board at the request of Capt Bullock to examine the state of the sails, which were immeadiately hoisted that they might the better see them (about loosed the whole, to dry) at 11 – 2 canoes & a boat are sent off to Matchedash for provisions at 1 PM wind ENE & commences raining, handed all sails – at 3 paid out more cable wind encreases – & still rains – at 8 set the watch wind still continues from the same quarter[.]

Fore part of this 24 hours rains & snows at times wind chops round to NNW – at 9 becomes more clear ceases snowing wind at North cold disagreeable weather, at noon the Sun makes its appearance – latter part of the day weather changeable, at 6 PM a heavy fall of snow – about 11 this forenoon the men assembled on the main and quarter deck to demand a supply of salt, & too know how they were to be rationed during the winter, also, asking for their full allowance of rum, this being curtailed since the 6th Inst answer, they get ½ gallon salt reply & as to provisions for the winter that cannot be told until we reach St Maries – at 8 PM set the watc[h.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
